item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says more Fed rate cuts are 'only ingredient missing' for stronger economy
item.description: Bessent on Thursday pressed the administration's desire for lower interest rates, saying they are the key to future economic growth.

item.title: Trade deficit in October hits smallest since 2009 after Trump's tariff moves
item.description: The trade shortfall was just $29.4 billion for October, down 39% from the prior month.

item.title: Layoff pace in December hit lowest level since mid-2024, Challenger says
item.description: Planned job cuts totaled 35,553 for the month, a 50% slide from November and an 8% decrease from the same period a year ago.

item.title: Private payrolls rose 41,000 in December, slightly below expectations, ADP says
item.description: Private sector job creation turned positive in December though at a bit softer pace than expected.

item.title: Euro zone inflation hits 2% in December, in line with forecasts
item.description: Euro zone inflation stood at 2% in December, flash data from Eurostat showed on Wednesday.
